question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 어법상 틀린 것은?
mainText:
Too  many  times  people,  especially  in  today’s
generation, expect things to just  <u>happen overnight.</u>
When  we  have  these  false  expectations,  it  tends  to
discourage  us  <u>from  continuing  to  move  forward.</u>
Because this is a high tech society, everything we want
 <u>have to be within the parameters of our comfort and
convenience.</u> If it doesn’t happen  <u>fast enough, we’re
tempted to lose interest.</u> So many people don’t want to
take the time it requires to be successful. Success is
not  a  matter  of  mere  desire;  you  should  develop
patience in order to achieve it. Have you  <u>fallen prey
to impatience?</u> Great things take time to build.
* parameter: 매개 변수, 제한
options: ① <u>happen overnight.</u>
② <u>from  continuing  to  move  forward.</u>

③ <u>have to be within the parameters of our comfort and
convenience.</u>

④ <u>fast enough, we’re
tempted to lose interest.</u>

⑤ <u>fallen prey
to impatience?</u>
explanation: everything을 주어로 하는 동사 자리이므로, 'has to'로 고쳐야 한다.

question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 어법상 틀린 것은?
mainText:
If you had wanted to create a “self- driving” car in the
1950s, your best option might have been to strap a
brick to the accelerator. Yes, the vehicle would  <u>have
been able to  move forward on its own, but it could not
slow down, stop, or turn to avoid barriers.</u> Obviously
not ideal. But does that  mean the entire concept of
the self- driving car is not  <u>worth pursuing?</u> No, it
only means that at the time we did not yet have the
tools  we  now  possess  to  help  enable  vehicles  to
operate  both  autonomously  and  safely.  This  once -
distant dream now  <u>seems within our reach.</u> It is
much the same story in medicine. Two decades ago,
we were still taping bricks to accelerators. Today, we
are approaching the point where we can begin  <u>to
bring  some  appropriate  technology  to  bear  in  ways
that advance our understanding of patients as unique
individuals.</u> In fact, many patients are already wearing
devices  that  monitor  their  conditions  in  real  time,
which  allows  doctors  to  talk  to  their  patients  in  a
specific,  refined,  and  feedback -driven  way  that 
<u>were not even possible a decade ago.</u>
* strap: 끈으로 묶다 ** autonomously: 자율적으로
options:
① <u>have
been able to  move forward on its own, but it could not
slow down, stop, or turn to avoid barriers.</u>
② <u>worth pursuing?</u>
③ <u>seems within our reach.</u>

④ <u>to
bring  some  appropriate  technology  to  bear  in  ways
that advance our understanding of patients as unique
individuals.</u>
⑤ <u>were not even possible a decade ago.</u>
explanation: [변형] way를 수식하는 관계사절의 동사이므로 ⑤ were을 was로 바꿔야 한다.

question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 어법상 틀린 것은?
mainText:

part  <u>because  older  technologies  have  become
absorbed into the furniture of our lives, so as to be
almost  invisible.</u>  Take  the  baby  bottle.  Here  <u>is  a
simple implement that has transformed a fundamental
human  experience  for  vast  numbers  of  infants  and

technology.</u> This technology might be  <u>thought of a

also function to save time, as bottle feeding allows for

Potentially, therefore, it has huge implications for the
management of time in everyday life, yet it is entirely

options:

almost  invisible.</u>

② <u>is  a
simple implement that has transformed a fundamental
human  experience  for  vast  numbers  of  infants  and
mothers,  yet  it  finds  no  place  in  our  histories  of
technology.</u>

③ <u>thought of a
classic time-shifting device, as it enables mothers to
exercise more control over the timing of feeding.</u>
④ <u>to substitute for the mother’s time.</u>
⑤ <u>discussions of high-speed society.</u>
explanation: <think of A as B : A를 B로 간주하다>를 수동태로 만든 문장이므로, ③ thought of를 thought of as로 고쳐야 한 다.

question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 어법상 틀린 것은?
mainText:
The most prevalent problem kids report is that they
feel  like  they  need  to  be  accessible  at  all  times.
Because  technology  allows  for  it,  they  feel  an
obligation. It’s easy for most of us  <u>to relate — you
probably feel the same pressure in your own life!</u> It is
really challenging to deal with the fact  <u>that we’re
human  and  can’t  always  respond</u> <u>instantly.</u>  For  a
teen  or  tween  who’s  still  learning  the  ins  and  outs
of social interactions, it’s even worse. Here’s  <u>how
this  behavior  plays  out  sometimes:  Your  child  texts
one  of  his  friends,  and  the  friend  doesn’t  text  back
right away.</u> Now it’s easy for your child to think, “This
person doesn’t want to be my friend anymore!” So he
texts again, and again, and again — “blowing up their
phone.” This can be stress- inducing and even read as
aggressive. But you can see how  <u>easy this could
happen.</u>
* tween: (10 ~ 12세 사이의) 십대 초반의 아동
options:
① <u>to relate — you
probably feel the same pressure in your own life!</u>

② <u>that we’re
human  and  can’t  always  respond</u>
③ <u>instantly.</u>

④ <u>how
this  behavior  plays  out  sometimes:  Your  child  texts
one  of  his  friends,  and  the  friend  doesn’t  text  back
right away.</u>

⑤ <u>easy this could
happen.</u>
explanation: 간접의문문의 구조로 사용된 <how + 형용사/부사+ 주어 + 동사>에서 뒷 부분이 완전한 절의 구조(this could happen)를 취하고 있으므로, how 다음에 부사가 나와야 하므로 ⑤ easy를 easily로 고쳐야 한다.

question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 어법상 틀린 것은?
mainText:

his  heels  to  the  floor  between  jumps.</u>  That  may  be
impossible no matter how strong the dancer  <u>is.</u> But
a short-footed dancer may have no trouble! Another
dancer may be  <u>struggling to complete a half-turn in

turn rate and the alignment of the body close to the
rotation axis  <u>tell her how to accomplish her turn
successfully.</u> In both of these cases, understanding and
working within the constraints  <u>imposed by nature

efficiently, minimizing potential risk of injury.</u>

his  heels  to  the  floor  between  jumps.</u>
② <u>is.</u>

③ <u>struggling to complete a half-turn in
the air.</u>

⑤ <u>imposed by nature

explanation: 주어가 동명사로 단수 취급을 해주어야 하므로, ④의 tell을 tells로 고쳐야 한다.

mainText:
Technologists  are  always  on  the  lookout  for
quantifiable metrics. Measurable inputs to a model are
their lifeblood, and like a social scientist, a technologist
needs to identify concrete measures, or “proxies,” for
assessing progress. This need for quantifiable proxies
produces a bias toward measuring things  <u>that are
easy  to  quantify.</u>  But  simple  metrics  can  take  us
further away from the important goals we really care
about, which may require  <u>complicated metrics or be
extremely difficult, or perhaps impossible, to reduce to
any  measure.</u>  And  when  we  have  imperfect  or  bad
proxies, we can easily fall under the illusion  <u>which
we are solving for a good end without actually making
genuine  progress  toward  a  worthy  solution.</u>  The
problem   of   proxies   results   in   technologists
frequently  <u>substituting what is measurable for what
is meaningful.</u> As the saying goes, “Not everything that
 <u>counts can be counted, and not everything that can
be counted counts.</u>”
* metric: 측정 기준
options:
① <u>that are
easy  to  quantify.</u>

② <u>complicated metrics or be
extremely difficult, or perhaps impossible, to reduce to
any  measure.</u>

③ <u>which
we are solving for a good end without actually making
genuine  progress  toward  a  worthy  solution.</u>

④ <u>substituting what is measurable for what
is meaningful.</u>

⑤ <u>counts can be counted, and not everything that can
be counted counts.</u>
explanation: 앞의 명사(the illusion)과 동격을 이루는 명사절 (we are ... a worthy solution)을 이끌고 있고, 뒤에 완전한 절 이 이어지므로 동격의 접속사 that이 오는 것은 적절하다.

<u>exhibit random activities at the cellular level, and body

by  these  activities  coupled  with  selection  of  those

 <u>genetical selected during development, but rather,

sculpting.  A  natural  consequence  of  the  strategy  is
great variability from individual to individual at the cell

the majority of cases,  <u>as the most likely outcome of
any given vagrancy event is that the individual will fail

that  vagrancy  can,  on  rare  occasions,  dramatically

can  be  extremely  important  when  viewed  at  the
timescales which ecological and evolutionary processes
unfold.</u>  <u>The  most  profound  consequences  of
vagrancy relate to the establishment of new breeding
sites, new migration routes and wintering locations.</u> 
<u>Each  of  these  can  be  occurred  through  different
mechanisms,  and  at  different  frequencies,  and  they
each have their own unique importance.</u>
options:

individuals are able to reorientate and return to their
normal ranges.</u>

any given vagrancy event is that the individual will fail

inhospitable  environmental  conditions,  and  perish.</u>

③ <u>Despite being infrequent, these events
can  be  extremely  important  when  viewed  at  the
timescales which ecological and evolutionary processes

sites, new migration routes and wintering locations.</u>

⑤ <u>Each  of  these  can  be  occurred  through  different

cell  and  molecular  levels,  even  though  large -scale
structures are quite similar.</u>
